name: portend
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to be a sign that something bad is likely to happen in the future: It was a deeply superstitious country, where earthquakes were commonly believed to portend the end of dynasties. Synonyms
augur formal
betoken old use
bode formal
foreshadow formal
prefigure formal
presage formal

to be a sign that something is likely to happen in the future: It was a major scandal whose full exposure portended the end of a popular presidential reign.
